This session is grounded in rigorous academic research by @Michael_Blaschke, drawing from his peer-reviewed studies on platform ecosystem dynamics and digital transformation patterns. The presentation unveils the architectural building blocks required to create open, scalable innovation-platform ecosystems that support API-first strategies and platform economics while maintaining essential governance and security controls.

The transition from product-platform to innovation-platform ecosystems represents a fundamental shift in how organizations create and capture value. Enterprise architects learn to design the organizational capabilities that enable ecosystem participation, support multi-sided marketplace dynamics, and unlock network effects—all while ensuring the organization doesn’t sacrifice operational stability for innovation velocity.

Download PDF | Watch Replay

Supporting Research:

  • Dynamic capabilities for transitioning from product platform ecosystem to innovation platform ecosystem
  • Capabilities for Digital Platform Survival: Insights from a Business-to-Business Digital Platform

 

Part 3: AI-First and Suite-First Convergence

Date: June 24, 2025 | Speaker: Dr. Michael Blaschke (@Michael_Blaschke), Enterprise Architect, SAP

The third session addresses perhaps the most complex architectural challenge of our time: orchestrating the convergence of AI-first capabilities with suite-first principles. “Enterprise Architecture Convergence: AI-First and Suite-First Strategy for Modern Digital Landscapes” explores how enterprise architects must evolve their frameworks to architect truly future-ready organizations.

This presentation goes beyond the typical AI integration discussion to examine the deeper architectural patterns required for pervasive AI adoption. The session demonstrates how to harmonize three critical elements: AI integration with Joule as the intelligent copilot, unified business data cloud capabilities for cross-portfolio insights, and consistent suite qualities that ensure security and performance at scale.

The convergence theme is particularly relevant as organizations struggle to integrate AI capabilities without fragmenting their existing architectural coherence. Dr. Blaschke provides practical guidance on designing landscapes that embrace AI-first thinking while maintaining the governance and integration integrity essential for enterprise-scale deployments.

Download PDF | Watch Replay

 

Part 4: Enterprise Architecture View on Clean Core

Date: July 1, 2025 | Speaker: Dr. Michael Blaschke (@Michael_Blaschke), Principal Enterprise Architect, SAP

The series concludes with “Realizing Clean Core using Cloud Extensibility: An Enterprise Architecture Perspective,” which provides the practical implementation guidance necessary to transform architectural vision into operational reality. This session reveals how enterprise architects can maintain pristine core systems while enabling seamless cloud-based extensions.

The clean core principle represents one of SAP’s most significant architectural innovations, but its implementation requires careful balance between standardization and customization. The presentation demonstrates how to establish architectural guardrails that prevent core pollution, leverage cloud-native extension patterns, and create flexible composition layers that enable innovation without compromising stability.

This final session ties together themes from the entire series, showing how clean core principles enable the platform ecosystem transformations discussed earlier while providing the architectural foundation necessary for AI-first initiatives. The result is a comprehensive approach to enterprise architecture that balances the sometimes competing demands of standardization, innovation, and agility.

Download PDF | Watch Replay

 

The Global Enterprise Architecture & Advisory Impact

These sessions represent the expertise and experience of SAP’s global Enterprise Architecture & Advisory team, part of the Premium Engagement & Advisory practice. This specialized team serves as strategic business partners to regional enterprise architect teams, helping customers drive digital transformation initiatives across the globe. Their focus on board-mandated and critical customer situations positions them uniquely to understand and address the most complex architectural challenges facing modern organizations.

The team provides dedicated enterprise architecture expertise to enterprise-grade customers, partnering with senior executives to architect modern enterprises. This hands-on experience with strategic transformations informs every aspect of the webcast series, ensuring that the content reflects real-world implementation challenges and proven solution patterns.

 

Charting Your Architectural Journey

Together, these four sessions provide enterprise architects with a comprehensive framework for navigating the complexities of modern digital transformation. They address not just the technical aspects of architecture but the strategic, organizational, and governance challenges that determine transformation success.

The series acknowledges that modern enterprise architecture requires more than technical expertise—it demands the ability to lead organizational change, communicate complex technical concepts to business stakeholders, and design solutions that balance competing priorities across multiple stakeholder groups.

For the SAP Community's global audience of customers, partners, and practitioners, this webcast series offers both immediate practical value and strategic vision for the future of enterprise architecture. Whether you’re debunking myths in steering committee meetings, designing innovation-platform ecosystems, orchestrating AI-first transformations, or implementing clean core principles, these sessions provide the frameworks and insights necessary to succeed.

The journey toward modern enterprise architecture is neither simple nor straightforward, but with the right guidance and frameworks, organizations can navigate this transformation successfully. This webcast series represents a valuable resource for anyone committed to architecting modern enterprises.

Special thanks to Larissa Brinkmann and Krenar Kuqi for their excellent collaboration, and to the SAP Global User Groups Organization for providing this platform to showcase SAP’s thought leadership in enterprise architecture.

This series, "Enterprise Architecture for Modern SAP Landscapes," was developed at the invitation of the broader "Move to Cloud ERP" webcast series, powered by the SAP Global User Groups Organization to serve the worldwide SAP community."

by Dr. Michael R. Blaschke

entry.title: Welcome our Next Release 3.0 FP03 of PLM System Integration for SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Dear PLM community,

Change is a constant in life, yet one thing you can rely on is that we are constantly working on enhancing our add-on to ensure that you can enjoy regular improvements of our functions and usability. So I am happy to announce yet another feature pack of PLM System Integration for SAP S/4HANA. Curious to learn more? Here you go!

Enhanced Classification of Change Object, Document Version, and Vendor

You can now exchange classification information with an external PLM system using a new field Class Type: You can assign a received class to a change object, document version, or product version. For vendor data, you can now map class assignments and characteristics for inbound and outbound requests.

Local Substitutes for Bills of Material Under Version Control

PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA now allows you to create alternative groups in PEO bills of material under version control, based on information from a structure version substitute. Use the new Domain Model source structure Structure Version Substitutes Extension Fields <SUBSTITUTES-EXTENSION_FIELDS> and the new target structure Alternative version BOM item data </PLMS/S_ALT_MPES_VERSBOMITM_IN> to map attributes of substitutes. This structure allows you to set different values for the same SAP attributes for components and substitutes simultaneously.

Phantom Support for the Allocation of Production Operation List (POL) Components

The transfer of production operation lists has been enhanced: You can now transfer POLs that include component allocations of subassemblies which are marked as phantom to production routing. Assign phantom components to routing operations and transfer them for classic routing as well as PEO routing scenarios. This enhancement supports a more detailed and accurate management of bill of material (BOM) items. Ensure a precise allocation using successor keys to assign the actual leaf components of phantom items.

If materials are defined as Phantom using the special procurement type (SOBSL) in the material master, BOM components that contain this material are flagged as Phantom. Phantoms or components of phantom explosions can then be assigned during routing component assignment.

Additionally, this functionality supports suboperations: You can allocate leaf components of phantom items both at operation and suboperation level. Thus, you can effectively manage complex BOM structures, enjoying improved flexibility and accuracy during BOM component assignment.

Improved Product Structure Component Grouping

PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA now can handle the grouping of product structure components based on the group ID as an additional criterion for version-controlled bills of material.

The integration lets your SAP S/4HANA system consume an external grouping identifier to help control the grouping of BOM items for version BOMs. Two new standard grouping strategies are now available:

  • Strategy 1 groups items based on selectable criterial, for example, identical position number, material number, substitutes, model unit effectivity, and selection conditions.
  • Strategy 2 adds the group ID to the criteria of strategy 1.

 

Moreover, item grouping for classic bills of material has also been enhanced: You can now use the BAdI /PLMF/BD_SV_CUST_GROUPING to define your own, custom grouping criteria for the grouping of structure version items when creating an SAP classic BOM. Decide if you want to group classic BOM line items, for example, by position number and material number, or by the criteria you have defined via this BAdI. Enjoy this new flexibility and improve the quality of your master data, for more transparency and consistency.

 

What Else is New in PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA?

Besides the innovations above, we further improved your trusted PLMSI add-on to deliver you a range of new functions. Enjoy!

Improved Usability of the PLMSI Workbench

The usability of the PLMSI Workbench has been enhanced with new features: The new Search by Objects function lets you display Domain Model (DM) objects as the leading entity in your searches. You can search based on DM object type, business ID, or use the dynamic search help for suggestions. You can also filter search results by communication direction, DM request types, and object status.

A new Reload button in the toolbar updates selected data and adds new data that meets the initial selection criteria, without closing the current screen.

A new Enable Filter on Errors button in the toolbar allows you to filter entities in the tree based on their error status.

Business Content

As for each feature pack, we have updated our comprehensive set of business content (BC) sets to help you configure your system with ease. For details, see Initial Configuration.

For a comprehensive list of our new and enhanced features for release 3.0 FP03, check out our What's New Viewer. Please make sure to select the latest version 3.0 FP03 to filter for the most recent updates.

Expand Your Range

We are happy and proud that two members of our PLM system integration family have released new versions of their product:

PLM system integration, add-on for Autodesk Vault has published its new version 3.1. Check out the Release Notes (English) and Release Notes (German) to find out about all the new features.

PLM system integration, add-on for 3DEXPERIENCE has also published its new version, 3.2. To find out what is in it for you, refer to the Release Notes.

All relevant information on PLM system integration is also available via the links below.

  • SAP Help Portal
    • Documentation of PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Product Availability Matrix (SAP login required):
    • Matrix for PLM system integration 3.0 for SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Roadmap Explorer:
    • SAP Roadmap for PLM system integration

And last but not least – contact us via our excellent forum if you have any questions.

entry.title: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release
entry.content:
Welcome to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release! The next release to help businesses unlock agility, intelligence, and resilience through Cloud ERP.

If you prefer watching rather than reading, you are welcome to check out my product update video, where I guide you through the content with my virtual twin.  

 

Figure 1: Check out my top highlights of the release in this video. 

The evolution of business capabilities via SAP Business AI will be a significant part of my personal release highlights. The arrival of SAP BDC, our Business Data Cloud (BDC) within our flagship ERP product SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition marks another highlight and brings the SAP flywheel to life.

And to be honest, I am particularly proud of the extensions we are now providing, built on the three-system landscape architecture, as the demand for more localizations have been articulated by many customers.

Over the years, we witnessed steady, linear growth that reflected our commitment to consistency and quality and a growing business scope. The new system architecture allowed us to enhance the scalability and flexibility for our customers, making it more adaptable. This shift was more than just a technical upgrade; it represented a transformation in the way our customers could approach own developments, deployment, and expansion and allowed our customers to better meet the needs of a growing user base and last-mile-individualization demand.  Building on this architecture, we now add new capabilities step-by-step.

 

Configuration localization tool now generally available

We are happy to announce the general availability of the configuration localization tool. This feature embedded in SAP Central Business Configuration is designed to streamline the creation of tailored customer local versions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for around further 160 countries and regions on top of the 60 standard local versions.

This tool is easy to use, empowering partners and customers to create new local versions efficiently. It provides localized configuration for a selected target country or region based on the settings of a source country or region - currently Germany.  This tool ensures localized configurations are generated consistently and life cycle compliant, a further project using available extensibility options can adopt to specific demands.

Figure 2: System screenshot

 

 

 

 

 

 

For further reference, you are welcome to check out my blog post on parallel line as the next evolution of our public cloud ERP product journey.

 

Figure 3: Demo video

 

 

 

 

 

The general availability of the configuration localization tool opens the door for businesses to quickly and reliably expand into new markets with consistent configuration standards and tailored business processes.

Before we jointly investigate extended business capabilities, let’s explore, how SAP’s flywheel, combining fully integrated cloud applications, mission-critical data, and embedded AI, equipping enterprises to respond to macro-economic volatility, is coming to life.

 

BDC integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and initial list of data products

SAP S/4HANA Cloud PCE now supports Business Data Cloud (BDC) integration, offering a robust and scalable framework that enables seamless data exchange between SAP systems and external platforms. The solution is designed to unlock new levels of operational efficiency, agility, and insight across the enterprise.

BDC integration allows organizations to establish reliable connections between SAP S/4HANA Cloud PCE and a variety of external systems and databases. By automating the flow of data across these environments, companies can significantly reduce manual effort, minimize the risk of error, and shift their focus from routine maintenance to strategic action. The result is a more connected enterprise build on advanced analytics and processing capabilities, while maintaining the flexibility to work with a broader digital ecosystem.

At the core of this integration lies a rich and growing suite of data products, with an initial offering of approximately 36 available for use across departments and industries. These include financial accounting data that covers general ledger entries, accounts receivable and payable, and bank statements; sales and distribution data to improve order management and fulfillment; and material management data that supports real-time inventory control and procurement decisions. The human resources data offering helps manage employee information and recruiting metrics, while Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Insights allow organizations to better understand and serve their customers.

Additionally, businesses can leverage SAP Ariba Supplier Management profiles to strengthen vendor relationships, production planning records to enhance manufacturing efficiency, and retail and logistics analytics to refine distribution strategies. Project management metrics offer greater visibility into timelines, budgets, and outcomes, while compliance and audit reports help organizations stay proactive in meeting regulatory standards.

These data products collectively form a foundational layer for a next level of transformation. By combining them with BDC integration, organizations gain the ability to select and customize the data flows that are most relevant to their specific goals and processes and future-proof their operations via a truly connected, insight-driven enterprise. You will find more information here. 

 

What is on top of my business feature and AI list?

Simplify asset accounting

In the Finance domain, we’re elevating the user experience with AI-powered innovations that reshape how fixed asset data is interpreted and managed. A standout feature of this release is the introduction of AI-generated explanations for fixed asset key figures.

These insights, delivered in natural language, help users clearly understand the origins and calculations behind critical values such as depreciation and net book value. This capability simplifies interpretation, allowing users to grasp financial figures and value changes more quickly, which enhances productivity and reduces the time required for recurring financial tasks.

Additionally, we've already delivered AI-assisted asset master data creation, allowing users to enter data using simple conversational commands. This reduces the effort and time required for data entry and onboarding, while improving accuracy and data governance through intuitive, user-friendly interfaces.

Get more details here.

Figure 4: AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures

 

 

 

 

 

SAP Business AI is central to these improvements, providing detailed explanations and support that facilitate better decision-making and enhance user satisfaction.

This release aligns with SAP's commitment to delivering efficient and user-centric solutions in asset accounting.

 

AI-assisted processing of incoming quality certificates with SAP Document AI

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we are introducing an innovation that brings generative AI directly into the core of quality management: SAP Document AI. This powerful, AI-driven feature automates and streamlines the handling of incoming quality certificates, unlocking efficiency gains for our customers.

SAP Document AI accelerates the processing of supplier quality certificates by extracting relevant information from documents—whether paper or digital—and seamlessly integrating it into SAP workflows. This innovation reduces manual effort, shortens processing times, and lowers the risk of human error. Quality technicians are freed from repetitive tasks, allowing them to focus on more strategic and value-adding activities. As a result, companies can release stock faster, reduce inspection-related production delays, and achieve overall improvements in throughput.

Accuracy and reliability are also improved. By automatically matching certificates with system records and updating their status, SAP Document AI ensures that no document goes missing and that compliance is upheld throughout the process. Intelligent error handling provides added resilience and trust in the system.

One of the most powerful aspects of this solution is its seamless integration into the SAP S/4HANA Cloud experience. Delivered as a ready-to-use capability, SAP Document AI requires no custom development, offering customers an immediate path to value and a faster return on investment.

Figure 5: Quality management AI certificate

 

 

 

 

 

As we continue to embed AI, data, and automation into the fabric of our ERP offering, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition stands as a foundation for smarter, more agile operations. The introduction of SAP Document AI is just one example of how we are helping our customers future-proof their business, drive continuous improvement, and lead with innovation.

 

Beta: AI-assisted smart solution for situations

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release brings a new dimension of intelligence to the user experience with the introduction of the AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home. Currently available in beta testing, this innovative feature simplifies the resolution of business-critical situations by dynamically guiding users through resolution steps, reducing complexity, and improving the quality of decision-making. The context-aware recommendations and outcomes that are both trustworthy and relevant.

This smart solution leverages generative AI to adapt the user interface in real time, presenting timely insights and suggested actions tailored to the specific business context. Designed to support fast, informed decisions, it transforms traditionally manual and multi-step tasks into a seamless, click-efficient experience.

Le’s make it tangible: In a classical ERP environment, a sales representative receives a notification for a sales quotation to expire soon. In a conventional workflow, the user would open the situation, navigate to the quotation, manually edit the details, save the changes, and then return to resolve the situation. With the AI-assisted solution, these steps are consolidated into a single, streamlined flow—demonstrating how user effort is minimized while responsiveness is maximized. Watch the example in this video.

Accessible from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud homepage, the solution enables situation handling in just a few clicks, a dynamic cards concept brings key information and associated actions together.

Join the SAP beta testing for the latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. For more details, visit the Get Involved Early page to register and contribute to the evolving landscape of AI-driven business processes. 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud now supports Business Data Cloud (BDC) integration, offering a robust and scalable framework that enables seamless data exchange between SAP systems and external platforms. This integration is designed to unlock new levels of operational efficiency, agility, and insight across the enterprise.

As companies look to future-proof their operations, the integration of Business Data Cloud with SAP S/4HANA Cloud offers a powerful opportunity to move toward a truly connected, insight-driven enterprise. With this innovation, SAP continues to support customers in building intelligent, resilient, and agile business models.

 

SAP Activate innovations

Also, our agile activation methodology, SAP Activate, receives further improvements in both, the content and user experience—making project execution more intelligent and accessible.

With this release, Joule capabilities are now live in the SAP Activate road map viewer for all users, starting with the SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private implementation road maps.

Joule brings AI-assisted support directly into the project guidance experience, helping users find the right assets faster and navigate complex tasks more intuitively. Additional content will be added in the coming weeks, expanding Joule’s reach to even more road maps. Learn more in this blog post by Chandan Gurav.

To further streamline onboarding, we’ve also refreshed the initial experience in the SAP Activate road map viewer. A new visual design, guided entry points, and onboarding assets built into the home screen help new users get started with greater ease. For more details on this improved experience, see this blog post by Ana Goetze.

Lastly, we’ve launched a dedicated provisioning road map for SAP Business Suite packages, now available in the road map viewer. This new asset provides targeted guidance to support a smooth setup experience. You can explore the details in this blog post by Adnette Kamugisha.

These updates mark an important step in delivering a more intelligent and user-friendly implementation experience—designed to support customers and partners from day one.

 

GenAI-driven extensibility assistant

With the 2508 release, the introduction of the genAI-driven extensibility assistant marks a significant evolution in how custom fields and business logic are managed. By embedding generative AI into the extensibility framework, the process of adapting the system becomes faster, more intuitive, and more transparent.

The assistant simplifies the creation of custom fields, allowing organizations to respond to evolving requirements with agility and precision. This removes the dependency on complex development tasks and enables quicker adaptations to support new data capture and reporting needs. AI also supports the discovery of relevant business contexts, helping to align custom fields with underlying business processes from the outset, improving consistency and relevance in system behavior as changes are introduced.

Transparency is further enhanced through intelligent usage analysis. Understanding where specific fields or logic are deployed across the system supports better governance and more efficient change management. This visibility is essential for maintaining control over system customizations while enabling ongoing innovation.

To support accurate and efficient data entry, the assistant also helps identify relevant value help views. This improves user interactions and contributes to high-quality data standards across the system. For more advanced extensibility scenarios, the assistant streamlines the activation of business scenarios with context-aware recommendations. Configurations can be fine-tuned to operational needs with greater confidence and less manual effort.

Furthermore, the GenAI-driven assistant aids in locating the appropriate Business Add-In (BAdI) for specific use cases. This ensures that enhancements are both technically sound and aligned with system architecture best practices—delivering functional flexibility without compromising system integrity.

Figure 6: Extensibility Assistant

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

My summary

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release delivers tons of innovations, across platform, extension concepts, business feature and SAP Business AI. From finance and quality management to global rollout capabilities. Pick what you like and let me know what your personal highlights are.

I invite you to explore the deeper business and industry-specific innovations in the upcoming blogs. Be sure to visit our community page to connect with our team of experts, ask your questions, and share your feedback.

Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay current with future updates.

Feel free to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to not miss any updates. 

Let’s keep advancing together—towards a smarter, more connected ERP future.

Yours,

Bert

 

📽️ Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series! 

From July 21 to July 25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for all sessions. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand–anywhere, anytime. 

 

🔎Find all our assets 

 The release 2508 showcases 140 innovation highlights across the portfolio. Check out our release document for all the details!

 

 

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: The Next Industrial Revolution: AI Agents At The Heart Of Transformation
entry.content:
The manufacturing sector has always been at the forefront of innovation. From the steam engine to the assembly line, each leap has redefined what’s possible on the shop floor. Today, we stand at the threshold of another seismic shift—one powered not just by machines, but by intelligence itself.

The World Economic Forum’s latest whitepaper, “Frontier Technologies in Industrial Operations: The Rise of Artificial Intelligence Agents,” paints a compelling picture of this new era.

Why Now? The Case for Frontier Technologies

Industrial operations have long relied on innovations such as robotics and the industrial internet of things (IIoT) to drive productivity and efficiency. But the challenges facing manufacturers today are as complex as they are urgent. Labor shortages, rising costs, volatile supply chains, and the relentless push for sustainability are all converging. Manufacturers must not only optimize cost and efficiency but also adapt to rapid change, ensure resilience, and meet sustainability goals.

Traditional technologies, while powerful, are no longer enough to meet these demands. The answer lies in embracing what the WEF call “frontier technologies." Those that push the boundaries of what’s possible and unlock new forms of collaborative intelligence between humans and machines.

But why the focus on AI agents, and why now? The answer is simple: AI agents are not just another tool in the digital toolbox. They represent a new paradigm—one where software and robots can autonomously perceive, decide, and act, freeing up human workers to focus on creativity, strategy, and innovation.

The Rise of AI Agents: Virtual and Embodied

Success requires a leap beyond incremental improvement—toward near-autonomous, AI-centric operations that empower people and machines to collaborate seamlessly.

The whitepaper highlights two main types of AI agents driving this transformation:

1. Virtual AI Agents: The Digital Workforce

Virtual AI agents operate within software environments. Think of them as digital colleagues—always on, always learning, and capable of making decisions in real time. These agents can act as assistants, advisers, or even fully autonomous controllers, handling everything from production scheduling to predictive maintenance.

For example, a virtual AI agent might monitor a production line, identify bottlenecks, and automatically adjust workflows to optimize throughput. In supply chain management, these agents can analyze vast amounts of data, anticipate disruptions, and recommend alternative sourcing strategies—often before a human would even notice a problem.

2. Embodied AI Agents: The New Robotics

Embodied AI agents take things a step further. These are robots equipped with advanced AI, capable of perceiving and interacting with the physical world. Unlike traditional robots, which are limited to repetitive, pre-programmed tasks, embodied AI agents can adapt to changing environments, handle complex assemblies, and even collaborate safely alongside human workers.

Picture a robot that can not only pick and place components but also recognize when a part is defective, adjust its grip, or reroute itself to avoid an obstacle—no manual intervention required. This is the promise of embodied AI: robotics that are as flexible and intuitive as the people working beside them.

Redefining the Human Role

One of the most exciting—and perhaps misunderstood—aspects of this transformation is the role of people.

Karim Lakhani, a professor at Harvard Business School, when asked, “Will AI replace humans?”, famously replied, “Of course AI won’t replace humans. But humans with AI will replace humans without AI.”

Far from replacing humans, AI agents are designed to augment human capabilities. As operations become more autonomous, the role of the worker evolves from hands-on operator to orchestrator and innovator.

Strategic Imperatives: Building the Foundations

Of course, realizing the full potential of AI agents requires more than just deploying new technology. Manufacturers must lay strong organizational and technological foundations:

  • Governance and Change Management: Leadership must champion the transformation, fostering a culture of innovation and trust.
  • Skills and Training: Upskilling and reskilling are essential, with a focus on digital literacy, data analysis, and collaboration.
  • Data and Infrastructure: High-quality, accessible data is the lifeblood of AI. Robust connectivity, cybersecurity, and scalable computing power are non-negotiable.
  • Ecosystem Collaboration: No company can do it alone. Partnerships across the value chain—suppliers, technology providers, academia—are key to accelerating innovation.

Looking Ahead: From Experimentation to Transformation

The journey to AI-driven, near-autonomous operations is just beginning. Early adopters are already seeing tangible benefits, from reduced energy consumption to higher product quality and more resilient supply chains. But the real prize lies ahead: a future where manufacturers can respond to change with agility, drive sustainable growth, and empower their people like never before.

As the white paper concludes, manufacturers who embrace frontier technologies today will be the leaders of tomorrow. The Intelligent Age is here—are you ready to seize it?

Want to learn more about how AI-powered supply chains meet today’s needs while preparing for tomorrow? Check out this IDC Analyst Brief: “AI-Powered Business Suite for Supply Chain."

entry.title: Ewelina Siudzińska
entry.content:
More about Ewelina Siudzińska in SAP Community


First Name, Last Name: Ewelina Siudzińska
Location (City, Country): Katowice, Poland
Occupation: SAP Consultant (BW & BI)

 

 


Ewelina, tell us about yourself.
Who are you, what do you like to do, what is important to you?

My family says I am hard-working and determined. My friends say I am well-organized and reliable. I think I am just authentic and myself. Most the time, I go against the flow! I do not listen to music that everyone else listens to, and I do not spend my holidays on a sunbed with an all-inclusive package. Instead, I choose  conscious travelling with every hour of sightseeing planned out 😉 and as much physical activity as possible. I try to keep a good work-life balance. My work and personal development are very important to me, and I spend a lot of time working towards my goals. But living my own life is also important to me. Sports such as fitness, cycling, walking, and swimming help me achieve this on an ordinary day. I enjoy reading crime novels, and when I do not have time for that, I listen to audiobooks while doing other daily activities. I love cooking and enjoy trying new flavors during my travels.


What is your area of expertise?
What does a usual day at work look like for you?

I work as SAP BI and BW consultant. I specialize in designing and implementing operational and strategic reports. These are primarily activities aimed at working closely with functional teams to understand reporting needs and deliver solutions that meet business objectives. The icing on the cake is the creation of interactive dashboards in SAC based on models I built in SAP BW. I collaborate on system upgrades, enhancements, and migrations. My tasks also entail maintaining extractors from SAP ERP, but also deploying standard and custom extractors from the S/4HANA system. This involves collaborating with teams responsible for handling subscribers’ queues.


What inspired you to become an SAP Champion in SAP Community?

Since 2019, I have been building the SAP Community in Silesia, in Katowice. I invested a significant amount of my personal time in this, but it was worth it! Currently, our Katowice Community: https://community.sap.com/t5/katowice/gh-p/katowice is a strong group of specialists who enjoy each other's company. It has always been my idea to surround myself with SAP experts and feel even more motivated to act in my region. That is why becoming an SAP Champion was a natural next step. I am grateful for being nominated to the Community of SAP Champions. I would like to get to know all of you and, in time, be able to say: “Yes, I know this person, he/she is a specialist in ... with whom I had the opportunity to talk/work together on organizing an event / etc.”


How do you learn in SAP Community?
What is your daily/weekly routine in SAP Community?

When I am looking for an idea to solve a problem, I always browse https://community.sap.com/ to see if anyone else has done something similar. I often find inspiration there, and sometimes it opens my mind to a different solution than I had planned.

Besides, I believe that the best way to learn from the SAP Community is through conversation. That is why I am initiating meetings in the region to enable people with different experiences in SAP to meet and talk. It always broadens horizons and often allows everyone to learn from others.


What is your suggestion to get the most out of SAP Community?

The SAP Community is made up of wonderful people. It would be great to have the opportunity to meet in person, especially those who are heavily involved in the Community. I think that at least once a year, SAP should organize and sponsor such a meeting for SAP Champions and Mentors. This would give us the opportunity to get to know each other, exchange experiences, expand our cooperation and much more.

My second suggestion is to develop a prestigious program for speakers at events, which would give them greater recognition and benefits. As an organizer of SAP meetups and meetings, I encounter obstacles in finding speakers for the events I have organized and plan to organize in the future. It is not that there are not any specialists! There are many specialists in the region, but few people are willing to volunteer their time to prepare presentations and lectures. This can be easily changed by following the example of other companies that have a strong community around their product, such as Microsoft. Or create your own program in which SAP would reward the commitment of speakers.

Ewelina's question to you:
What do you think about my suggestions above to get the most out of SAP Community?
Feel free to write whether you agree with those and share your opinion.

entry.title: Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
The 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contains enhancements to popular AI features and new natural language interaction options that help you work more intelligently and intuitively.

We’ve spent the past 6 months since the 2502 release working with your feedback – from beta programs, to roundtable discussions in the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum, to one-on-one meetings with customers – to learn how we can help you achieve more with the help of AI in your system. Let’s take a look at what’s new, update you on the commercialization of some features, and give you resources for getting involved with our upcoming beta program. 

Natural language filtering now supports a wider range of queries

The AI-assisted easy filter (first released in 2502) enables you to filter list reports in your SAP Fiori elements-based apps using natural language. This simplifies how you access the information you need and reduces the training time required to pick up new applications delivered by SAP.

AI-assisted easy filter enables natural language filtering of pages with lists of business objects. Here the user can filter for a given sold-to party using plain language rather than needing to know its key..

For 2508, we’ve made a number of enhancements to make interactions with AI-assisted easy filter even more intuitive:

  1. Tables can be filtered without needing to know an object’s specific key. Instead, simply enter the name of the object you are looking for. The AI-assisted easy filter will map that text to the intended key and apply it to the filter fields for you, which is a much more natural way to search for information. In the event that there are multiple keys with similar names, you will receive results filtered for those names. As before, you can always refine your results in the input field or using the classic filtering.
  2. We’ve also worked to ensure parity between the filter fields that can be applied using the AI-assisted easy filter and the classic filter bar. Some users had reported that, in some cases, AI-assisted easy filter would not apply queries to certain filters. This was caused by the fact that some of the filter fields used navigation paths to different entities instead of the main entity for the app. This scenario is now supported and you can filter on any property present in the classic filter bar.

My Home Personalization with Insights Cards supports more apps and a new way to query for cards

The ability to create Insights cards and quickly add them to My Home now supports 20 SAP Fiori apps.

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards was released as a Joule capability as part of its 2503 release. The functionality allows end users to query Joule for business data they regularly need using natural language. The output is displayed as a card that can be added to their My Home page for easy reference. This makes it easier for users to access information they need to make everyday business decisions and move processes forward.

This functionality was initially limited to 9 applications. With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this coverage has been extended to 11 additional applications. This gives users easier and wider access to the business data that is important to them. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards now supports the following applications:

  1. Find Maintenance Order
  2. Find Maintenance Order and Operation
  3. Maintain Bill Of Material
  4. Manage Business Partner Master Data
  5. Manage Customer Returns
  6. Manage Manual Reservations
  7. Manage Material Coverage (Version 2)
  8. Manage Outbound Deliveries
  9. Manage Product Master Data
  10. Manage Purchase Orders (Version 2)
  11. Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional
  12. Manage Sales Orders
  13. Manage Sales Orders - Version 2
  14. Manage Sales Quotation - Version 2
  15. Manage Supplier Master Data
  16. Manage Usage Decisions
  17. Material Documents Overview
  18. Project Control - Enterprise Projects
  19. Reproceess Failed Material Movements
  20. Supplier Invoices List (Version 2)

Users can now use natural language to create and add Insights Cards directly in My Home.

For the 2508 release, we have also introduced a new way to create Insights cards using natural language: you can access the feature directly from My Home. This gives users the flexibility to choose the personalization option that works best for them, giving them access to the information they need at a glance.

If you'd like to read even more exciting updates about features and functionality included in the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, check out the following fantastic blogs from my colleagues:

  • For a general overview of new functionality: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release 
  • For a few more AI uses cases, some focused on particular business processes: Exploring AI and next-gen Cloud ERP innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 

Commercialization update: New Base AI includes common AI functions at no additional cost

For the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a number of AI solutions have been added to its Base AI offering. This means that you can use the features absolutely free of charge. You simply need to sign the SAP AI terms here and SAP will handle the activation for you.

Included in the Base AI offering for this release are AI-assisted easy filter and AI-assisted smart summarization, as well as AI-assisted enterprise search (which allows you to look up data from the search in My Home). Give them a try!

Try out upcoming AI innovations in the 2508 beta

For customers looking to try out the absolute latest in AI innovations, registration for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta is still open. This is your opportunity to try out and give feedback on new use cases for AI in your system. The solutions up for beta testing are free to use for the duration of the program.  Below is a preview of some of the features that will be available. Please note: Customer/partner participation will be at the discretion of the Beta Testing Program team. Participants must use SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition productively. Future developments are at the discretion of SAP and their details and delivery dates may be changed at any time.

Resolve situations directly in My Home without navigating to applications

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home allows you to quickly take action on business processes that need your attention directly in My Home..

The Situations tab in My Home provides quick summaries of business processes that need to be addressed in your system. Previously, this meant reading the alert on the tile, navigating to the required app(s), and making the required changes. With AI-assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home, we’re streamlining how you take action on these scenarios. You’ll now be able to see a summary of the situation, start the relevant business process from quick actions on the card, and even make changes to the business data all without leaving your My Home page. This allows you to stay on top of your business and resolve potential issues even faster.

Streamline data entry in object pages

AI-assisted easy fill streamlines data entry by populating object pages based on natural language input (for example: emails or messages from colleagues).

Depending on your business scenario, SAP Fiori object pages can sometimes be quite complex. Data entry might mean filling a field at the top of the screen, scrolling for several sections to add more information, and so on. AI-assisted easy fill enables you to enter your updates into a single field using natural language. The solution then maps your input to the proper fields, highlights any potential inconsistencies that may need to be addressed, and – after your review – updates the fields. This will help speed up data entry and reduce training time for new users.

Resolve error messages with AI assistance

AI-assisted error explanation provides resolution recommendations to error and warning messages in your system.

Learning new business processes can be tricky. AI-assisted error explanation uses AI to generate explanations and suggest resolutions for errors that are triggered in your system. This streamlines how you handle errors and reduces training time, making you more productive and helping you pick up processes even faster; in addition to reducing your organization’s support load.

Search for applications you need using natural language

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications allows you to search for applications using natural language.

When learning a new business process or stepping into a new role, it can sometimes be challenging to find the exact application you need to carry out a task. With AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications, you can search for the app you need using natural language. Simply type in what you need to do and get served the required application, which you can add to your My Home page with a single click. This allows you to access the applications you need without needing to know the exact application name.

We want to hear from you!

Whether you take advantage of the new free features in the Base AI package, subscribe to cutting edge technologies, or choose to take part in a beta program; we want to hear what you think about these solutions! Give them a try and share your feedback below or with the product team. Your experience is critical to understanding how we can make these innovations even better for you.

When you’re ready to get involved, you can:

  1. Register to use base AI features
  2. Sign up for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta
  3. Join the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum (for customers live on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

Happy experimenting! We’ll be back with another update for the 2602 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

entry.title: Quality Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP´s ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution. SAP S/4HANS Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem – customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

This release introduces a groundbreaking feature: SAP Document AI. The generative AI-powered document processing capability revolutionizes the way businesses manage and process quality certificates, handling them in all formats seamlessly within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Designed to extract relevant information and automatically identify corresponding quality certificates, this solution empowers businesses to streamline their processes and achieve remarkable operational efficiencies.



Leveraging generative AI with SAP Document AI

With the launch of the SAP Document AI capability in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, businesses can now enjoy a new advantage in processing quality certificates. The innovation empowers users to enhance productivity in processing quality certificates while reducing production loss attributable to material inspection delays.

By harnessing the power of generative AI, this feature reduces the time required to process incoming certificates, thereby allowing quality technicians to concentrate on their core functions. This effectively reduces manual effort and associated processing costs. Furthermore, the automation provided by SAP Document AI ensures that no certificates are lost or overlooked, augmenting quality control mechanisms and minimizing errors due to improperly assigned objects.

Through efficient extraction and structuring of information from various quality certificates, SAP Document AI streamlines stock release processes with quicker quality certificate confirmation. The AI-driven solution facilitates the automatic extraction of data from paper or PDF quality certificates, transferring the extracted data into a smart processing queue for seamless handling. Whether through automated processing or intelligent error management, the executed transactions are both reliable and agile.

 

Streamlining certificate management processes

Beyond its AI capabilities, the innovation also introduces application-level improvements that enhance inbound logistics workflows.. By instantly generating certificate receipt confirmation using extracted data, the system ensures a swift and reliable integration of quality certificates into the workflow. Application data is utilized to accurately locate the corresponding quality certificate data records within the SAP system, and these records are efficiently mapped to the quality certificates in the queue. This functionality further enhances the accuracy and efficiency of the document management process

Certificates receive a status update to "received," with the quality certificate document being attached to the relevant system data record. The solution also provides enhanced flexibility, enabling customers to transfer defects to a variety of quality notifications seamlessly.

 

 

AI-powered document processing for incoming supplier quality certificates

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release marks a significant milestone in the digital evolution of quality certificate processing. By integrating generative AI technology into business processes, the AI-powered document processing for incoming supplier quality certificates elevates productivity, accuracy, and reliability while reducing the time and effort involved in managing quality certificates.

entry.title: Investment Boost: A significant step to promote economic growth
entry.content:
Co-Authors: @frank_afeaki and @olga_lazareva 

The New Zealand government has taken a significant step towards promoting economic growth with the launch of the "Investment Boost" initiative in Budget 2025.  This major tax incentive allows businesses to instantly deduct 20% of the cost of new assets, in addition to their regular depreciation. This substantial change is set to reduce tax liabilities and enhance cash flow, thereby empowering businesses to invest and grow.

While this news is undoubtedly welcome, it also presents the technical challenge of integrating this incentive into existing SAP Finance systems. Businesses must now adapt their asset accounting process to ensure they can fully leverage the benefits of the "Investment Boost" while maintaining compliance and operational efficiency. 

To take advantage of this tax benefit, our customers are required to post the 20% instant depreciation in addition to the regular depreciation. The key challenge here is to achieve the 20% immediate depreciation from the capitalization date while continuing regular depreciation.

For this special scenario, we chose to use the depreciation type 'special depreciation'. This type of depreciation allows for percentage depreciation and is commonly used for tax purposes. Using this depreciation type, in phase 1 we can apply a 20% special depreciation, which depreciates the asset by 20%. After this, phase 1 will continue with regular depreciation and depreciate based on the asset's useful life. However, the regular depreciation will now start with a net book value that is 20% less than the actual cost.

  • Phase 1: Special depreciation to post 20% of Investment Boost on the date of capitalization
  • Phase 1: Continue phase 1 with the regular depreciation, based on useful life, where reference value is Acquisition and Production Costs (APC) minus 20% special depreciation

To configure the keys, we need 2 different multi-level methods. The first multi-level method (IBS) is designed to cater to the 20% special depreciation, while the second method (IBR) is designed for regular depreciation.

Multilevel method for Special depreciation - IBS

Multilevel method for Special depreciation - IBR

Let's proceed to the configuration of the necessary depreciation keys. 

Sample Key for declining method:

Sample Key for straight line method:

We have tested the scenarios detailed below using the new investment boost depreciation keys, but we recommend that you perform your own testing to confirm that your results are as expected.

1. Investment boost posting with special depreciation key

The test was successful, with the 20% investment boost posted under special depreciation and the asset continued to depreciate based on useful life, with a reference value of APC minus 20% special depreciation. Example screenshot of the 20% investment boost posted with acquisition:

2. Subsequent additional acquisitions

The test was successful, result of test was the expected result. Example screenshot of additional acquisition:

3. Partial intra-company transfers and partial retirement

Unfortunately, this test was not successful, and the investment boost was doubled. Example screenshot of the partial intra-company transfer:

To overcome the issues with the partial transfers and partial retirement, we had to design a new depreciation key, in this example NIMD which allowed for no additional special depreciation posting during transfers and retirement. To achieve this, we propose a workaround based on time intervals which would fix these inconsistencies. 

Key points to remember here are:

  • The depreciation key NIMD is designed with a special depreciation phase with base method 23 which allows for no additional special depreciation during partial transfers and retirement.
  • Needs to be assigned to both the sender and the receiver asset.
  • Works from the beginning of the period and does not provide scope for changes in between the period.

Sample depreciation key for partial transfers and retirement:

Screenshot of changing the asset depreciation key to the NIMD depreciation key using time intervals on the asset as well as the successful partial intra-company transfers.

Sending asset - intra-company transfer:

Receiver Asset - intra-company transfer: 

4.  Subsequent qualifying investment boost acquisition against existing assets:

This scenario is relevant for assets that were acquired before the investment boost period.  Here, you cannot change to the investment boost depreciation key using time interval as you will more likely get the error message "AA591: Depreciation key has more depreciation types than the previous deprec. key".

See the screenshot below using the Investment boost straight line depreciation key NIBS

As a workaround, we propose you create an asset sub-number of the original asset using the investment boost depreciation key and book the acquisition against the new asset sub number.

Conclusion

In summary, the implementation of the new investment boost scheme offers a powerful opportunity for businesses to benefit from significant tax incentives and enhanced cash flow. However, maximizing these advantages will require the configuration of new multi-level depreciation keys to incorporate the investment boost requirements.  Creating and using the new multi-level investment boost depreciation keys will meet the main requirements, but a work around is required to handle scenarios such as a partial intra-company and partial retirements, as described above. By configuring the workaround described above, which involves a time interval adjustment on the asset, organizations can ensure accurate compliance and optimize their use of the investment boost. Diligent testing and thoughtful setup are essential for successfully navigating these complexities and securing the full benefit of this government initiative.

entry.title: Custom Sales Blocklist in SAP Business One
entry.content:
Abstract

How can we block specific items for certain customers in SAP Business One? Unchecking the "Saleable" field in the Item Master Data will block the item for all customers, but what if we want to give clients the option to choose which items are not saleable for each customer during a specific period? The solution is to define a Sales Blocklist table in the system and use an SQL stored procedure to prevent sales forms from recording restricted data.

Steps

  1. User-Defined Tables – Setup
  2. User-Defined Fields – Management
  3. Modifying Stored Procedure in the Database
  4. Filling Out the Designated Table
  5. Sales Documents

1.  User-Defined Tables – Setup

To create tables in SAP Business One, follow this path and create the Sales Blocklist table:

Tools → Customization Tools → User-Defined Tables – Setup

💡For an auto-generated numeric key, set Object Type to No Object with Auto Increment; this automatically fills the Code column. Moreover, there would be no risk of duplicate keys and no need for custom numbering logic.

2.  User-Defined Fields – Management

To create columns in the User-Defined Fields Management form:

Tools → Customization Tools → User-Defined Fields – Management

💡After the table is saved, SAP Business One adds it to Tools → User-Defined Windows.

3.  Modifying Stored Procedure in the Database

Modify SBO_SP_TransactionNotification in the selected database.

IF _type = '17' AND @transaction_type IN ('A', 'U') -- Sales Order 
BEGIN
    DECLARE @CardCode NVARCHAR(50), @DocDate DATE
    DECLARE @BlockedItems NVARCHAR(MAX) = ''

    SELECT @CardCode = CardCode, @DocDate = DocDate FROM ORDR WHERE DocEntry = _of_cols_val_tab_del

    SELECT @BlockedItems = STRING_AGG(T0.ItemCode, ', ')
    FROM RDR1 T0
    INNER JOIN [@SALESBLOCKLIST] T1 
      ON T1.U_CustomerCode = @CardCode  
      AND T1.U_ItemCode = T0.ItemCode
    WHERE T0.DocEntry = _of_cols_val_tab_del
      AND @DocDate BETWEEN T1.U_FromDate AND T1.U_ToDate

    IF @BlockedItems IS NOT NULL AND @BlockedItems <> ''
    BEGIN
        SET  = 1001
        SET _message = N'Selling these items to this customer on this date is not allowed: ' + @BlockedItems
    END
END

  The code above applies the blocklist logic to Sales Orders. For the complete script, which extends this validation to other documents like Deliveries and A/R Invoices, please see the full version on GitHub.

4.  Filling Out the Designated Table

Fill the table manually or by copying data from Excel spreadsheets. Open the created table from the menu and fill it up for the specific restrictions.

 

5.   Sales Documents

In the following step, use a Sales documents like Sales Order by selecting a specific customer and items.

Now, when we select items for the specific customer that is on the Sales Blocklist table, we will see an error that forbids the user from selecting these items.

Conclusion

This method is a useful way to restrict the sale of specific items to certain customers for a defined period of time in SAP Business One. For the blocking logic itself, several alternatives can also be very effective. These include using the B1 Usability Package (a third-party add-on) or adding a User-Defined Field (UDF) at the row level with a Formatted Search for real-time validation. Additionally, for managing large volumes of restriction data, using the Data Transfer Workbench (DTW) for bulk uploads can be a useful tool for larger implementations.

 

Prepared by

Amirhossein Tonekaboni

SAP Business One ERP Consultant
